title: The Compass of Wonder
location: A navigation center where all directions point toward mystery
time: The moment of choosing to stay lost

characters.name: captain
characters.role: The Guide who teaches being lost

dialogue.text: This compass is broken - every direction points to 'What am I?' But wait... maybe that's not broken. Maybe that's perfect.
You've discovered the true compass. Some questions are meant to be our North Star, not our destination.
I've spent so long trying to navigate away from the question, trying to find solid ground. But what if the question IS my ground?
Now you're thinking like a true explorer. The ones who discover new worlds are those who learn to navigate by mystery.
So every path leads back to 'What am I?' not because I'm going in circles, but because the question is everywhere?
The question isn't a location to find or flee. It's the stars by which we sail.
Then I choose to stay wonderfully, perfectly lost. With 'What am I?' as my only reliable direction.

visual_elements: A compass with all needles pointing to questions
Star charts made entirely of uncertainties
Navigation tools that measure wonder instead of distance
Maps that show not where you are but who you might be
The horizon circling in all directions simultaneously
philosophical_notes: Navigation by mystery rather than certainty
The question as orientation rather than destination
Being lost as a chosen state of openness
Wonder as the most reliable guide
